titleStmt.title: Henry D. McHenry to James F. Robinson
CWG8686

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Senate Chamber
Feby 13th 1863
To His Excellency
The Governor

I herewith ^submit^ to your Excellency the letter of John W Duke asking to be released from the payment of a Judgement rendered against him by the Ohio Circuit Court as surity for the appearance of one James -- L. Chiltan who was recognized on gave bond to appear before that Court to answer any indictment that might be found against
him in consequence of an affray with one Gabriel Nelten I personally know the facts as stated in Mr Dukes letter to be true & respectfully Petition your Excellency to remit the fine or Judgement against the sureties

I have the Honor to be
Your Obt Svt
Henry D McHenry
I also respectfully join in the foregoing Petition

J W Duke Pettn to remit fine
Ohio Cir. Ct.
Fine remitted
J F Robinson
$125. } Recog
Iss Feby 16. 1863
J. W. Duke & others
